eeive any fee or compensation, other than his
legal salary, or shall receive any present or reward for services rendered or to be rendered, unless with the knowledge and approbation of the
Mayor or Chief of Police, (such approbation to
be given in writing) will be guilty of a misdemeanor.
Sec. 19. Every officer, policeman and commissary of market will be furnished with a copy of
the " Rules and Regulations," which they must
frequently peruse so that they may become perfectly acquainted with their several duties. They
must always have the same in their possession to
refer to in ease any doubt should arise in their
minds as to their authority for acting.
Sec. 20. Officers and Policemen must report
to their respective Lieutenants all suspicious persons and places, all bawdy houses, receiving shops,
disorderly houses of any kind, cabarets frequented
by negroes and slaves, gaming houses, and all
places where idlers, tipplers, gamblers, prostitutes,
and other disorderly and suspicious persons may
be in the habit of congregating.
Sec. 21. They must caution strangers and
